sentence:
Integrity and compliance
Materiality and goals
GRI 3-3
Targets Target horizon
With its integrity activities, the Mercedes-Benz Group pursues the following central goals:
– Minimise risks through knowledge of and compliance with the Integrity Code
– All employees and managers behave and act in an ethical and responsible manner Ongoing
– Exchange and dialogue on current integrity priorities
– Feedback from integrity analyses is incorporated into measures designed to strengthen the culture of integrity
With its compliance activities, the Mercedes-Benz Group particularly pursues the following central goals:
– Respect and uphold human rights
– Comply with anti-corruption regulations
– Engage in and promote fair competition
Ongoing
– Compliance of products with technical and regulatory requirements
– Observe data protection laws
– Comply with all applicable embargoes and sanctions
– Prevent money laundering and terrorist financing

sentence:
WLTP
WLTP (Worldwide Harmonised Light Vehicle Test
Procedure – WLTP) is an international measurement
standard that is used to determine how much fuel a car
consumes and whether it complies with the emission
limits.
label: unlabeled

sentence:
The WLTP replaced the former measurement
standard NEDC on 1 September 2017.
label: unlabeled

sentence:
In the WLTP cycle,
certification values are determined for each vehicle
from its mass, air and rolling resistance, and optional
equipment.
label: unlabeled

sentence:
It also includes a test under real driving
conditions (RDE).
label: unlabeled

sentence:
WLTP-TML/WLTP-TMH
The suffixes “TML” and “TMH” refer to the range
of possible assessments of a vehicle in the WLTP
measurement standard.
label: unlabeled

sentence:
The values for aerodynamics,
rolling resistance and vehicle mass change depending
on the optional equipment used.
label: unlabeled

sentence:
These circumstances
are taken into account in the WLTP cycle.
label: unlabeled

sentence:
TML (test
mass low) stands for the most favourable and TMH
(test mass high) for the least favourable case.
